Our stories

[**"The Death of Code as Craft"**](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9ldmVyeS50by9wL3RoZS1kZWF0aC1vZi1jb2RlLWFzLWNyYWZ0IiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjV9) _by Jon Christensen:_ Coding is fun because you feel like an artist, constructing objects out of digital bits. Will AI make coders irrelevant factory-line labor? Read Jon's piece to see if coding is changing from an art form to something weirder, maybe easier, and more strategic. 

[**"The Right Kind of Asshole"**](https://every.) _by Evan Armstrong/Napkin Math:_ Our tech ecosystem is overrun with grifters who take capital from worthy founders. The challenge is that the signals of greatness are similar to those of being terrible. Read this for the five signs of grit and five signs of grift in founders.

[**"Patreon Should Buy Substack to Save Creators"**](https://every.) _by Evan Armstrong/Napkin Math:_ Every media company you know is panickingâ€”traffic is declining, ad revenue is sagging, and creators are stuck in the middle. The solution? Patreon should raise a bunch of cash and buy Substack. Read this if you want to see how a combined "Patrestack" could reshape the creator economy, deliver better economics to creators, and maybe even make the internet a bit less awful for all of us. 

[**"ChatGPT and the Future of the Human Mind"**](https://every.) _by Dan Shipper/Chain of Thought:_ As AI encroaches on what we've long considered uniquely humanâ€”our intellectâ€”it's normal to feel both excited and threatened. But by understanding what AI tools like ChatGPT actually do (like summarize information), we can redefine what makes us human and find a new sense of purpose in the creative process. Read this to learn how technology has been changing our brains for generations, and how we can use AI to create more richness and beauty in the world. ðŸ–¥ Watch it as a video essay on [_YouTube_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g%5Fdj1jdUJ6ZklzWHlJSSIsInBvc2l0aW9uIjo5fQ==) _or_ [_Spotify_](https://every.)_, or listen to it on_ [_Apple Podcasts_](https://every.%5FaT0xMDAwNjU1MTc5NjUzJTIwIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjExfQ==)_._

ðŸŽ‰ [**"Brandon Gell Joins Every as Our First Entrepreneur in Residence"**](https://every.) _by Dan Shipper and Brandon Gell:_ We have some exciting news! Brandon Gell, the former CEO of Clyde, a fintech startup that raised $50 million before being acquired, is joining us as our first entrepreneur in residence. Together, we'll be incubating new software and services that will be bundled into Every subscriptions. Read this to learn more about our vision for the future of Every.

The backchannel

_Evanâ€™s dissection of the_ [_characteristics of grit versus grift_](https://every.) _in founders generated a robust discussion:_

> â€œYou highlight fair evidence, but there is something missing from this formula. Getting people to join you in building that bold idea, and staying for the journey, is an often missing consideration among Valley folk. Itâ€™s not a sexy thing to talk aboutâ€”you cannot brag about it at a board meeting or boast about it with your LPs. It is inward, viscous, nuanced, and requires superhuman enduranceâ€¦I wonder what would happen if we had more women running companies.â€ â€”_Health tech founder_ 

> â€œEffective leadership isnâ€™t about being tough so much as itâ€™s about knowing how to inspire your team and get\[ting\] them to buy into your companyâ€™s vision.â€ â€”_B2B marketer_ 

_Danâ€™s_ [_video essay_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cueW91dHViZS5jb20vd2F0Y2g%5Fdj1jdUJ6ZklzWHlJSSIsInBvc2l0aW9uIjoxNH0=) _about ChatGPTâ€™s impact on our intellect sparked a creative response:_

> â€œItâ€™s insanely good, like if Terry Gross had a baby with Charlie Rose and that baby lived with a Tibetan monk for 10 years but then they had a climactic fight on the Annapurna and the monk said before falling down the cliff â€˜I am your real Father. Terry and I were loversâ€™ so the boy ran down the trail in tears and at the bottom he discovered a cake and coffee shop where he was handed an iPhone and then said â€˜Letâ€™s see what this does,â€™ then started a podcastâ€¦â€ _â€”A playwright._ 

_Want to chat? DM_ [_Dan_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9kYW5zaGlwcGVyIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjE1fQ==) _or_ [_Evan_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9pdHN1cmJveWV2YW4iLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6MTZ9) _on X._

Chain of links

**OpenAI \[baguette edition\] raises more capital.** French AI company Mistral is rumored to be raising $600 million at a [$6 billion](https://every.) valuation, nearly tripling its valuation in six months. I donâ€™t know how to interpret these roundsâ€”either its investors see value in EU-specific models or think that Meta will [stop releasing open-source models](https://every.). If you are putting capital in this round, contact us! We would love to publish a bull thesis on this deal. 

**Legalize the AI drugs.** Google DeepMind (its AI division) released [Alpha Fold 3](https://every.), an AI model that can â€œaccurately predict the structure of proteins, DNA, RNA, ligands and more, and how they interact.â€ The executive in charge predicted it could be a [$100 billion](https://every.) division in the next couple of years. This is a genuine scientific marvel, and if I had a nickel for every time an executive said their project would be huge, I would drive a Maserati. 

**Searching for revenue.** OpenAI is [rumored](https://every.) to be releasing a search engine to compete with Google on Monday. We know that models can do thisâ€”the key questions are about the user interface and execution. How will OpenAI feature publishers? How will ads be sold and displayed? Who knows if this effort will work, but OpenAI sets the design paradigm that other AI companies follow. 

**AI did a naughty copy.** Let it be known that we donâ€™t think LLMs only fart rainbowsâ€”they can be used for ill, too. This [investigation](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9mdXR1cmlzbS5jb20vYWR2b24tYWktY29udGVudCIsInBvc2l0aW9uIjoyMn0=) into a company called AdVon discovered that many major publishers, brands like _USA Today_ and _Sports illustrated_, were publishing AI-created drivel while passing it off as being written by real humans. Then, to their horror, the journalists doing the investigation learned their parent company is also a client. An absolutely cracking read filled with drama, lies, and fraud. One of our favorites of the week. [Read it](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9mdXR1cmlzbS5jb20vYWR2b24tYWktY29udGVudCIsInBvc2l0aW9uIjoyM30=)! â€”[_Evan Armstrong_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9ldmVyeS50by9ASXRzVXJCb3lFdmFuIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjI0fQ==)

The napkin math

**50,000 paid robotaxi rides.** Always ignored, forever discounted, 10 years into the journey, Waymo robotaxis are now [working at scale](https://every.). If this continues, Google has deployed a technology that will save tens of thousands of lives and reduce our reliance on cars. _Note: Both_ [_Dan_](https://every.%5Fc2lkPTQzNDIyIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjI2fQ==)[_and I_](https://every.) _noted that the technology was working months ago. A reminder that reading Every lets you know the future first_. 

**The Apple pencil does a barrel roll.** The cyberpunk Granny Smith released some new iPad stuff this week. It was all a forgettable spec bump. As one of our designers, [Keshav](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9rZXNoYXZjaGFuIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjI4fQ==), put it, â€œHighlightâ€”apple pencil can now do a barrel roll.â€ Translation: The pen can track if you turn it on its side. The company unveiled a new chipâ€”[the M4](https://every.)â€”that appears to have latent capacity meant for AI applications. Whether or not that is meaningful depends on whether WWDC will include major AI announcements. 

**Googleâ€™s sniffing around a $30 billion enterprise SaaS acquisition.** HubSpot produces a combination marketing, sales, and operations software (boring). Basically, it has many customers who have lots of data, atop of which the software performs repetitive tasks. If you pair that with Googleâ€™s distribution and, more importantly, its AI capabilities, you have a legitimate shot at taking over the enterprise SaaS market, which has historically been the realm of Microsoft. I kind of like [this deal](https://every.).

**85 percent of U.S. teens play video games, 42 percent daily.** According to a [survey](https://every.) from Pew Research, teens are very, very plugged in. I donâ€™t think this is necessarily good or evil, but it is _different._ The critical issue is whether they are playing games that are borderline casino, money-sucking dopamine festsâ€”_Candy Crush_ or loot box mechanics, for exampleâ€”or if they are spending enriching time with their friends. Our relationship with our devices will be the defining issue of the next generation.

**We called it on Pinterest.** About 18 months ago, I [published](https://every.) a bull call on Pinterest, predicting that the company was on the verge of fixing its problems. I was very right: The stock is up about 80 percent since I published. Another reminder of why you bother to read us (_wink_). â€”[_EA_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9ldmVyeS50by9ASXRzVXJCb3lFdmFuIiwicG9zaXRpb24iOjMzfQ==)

## 

---

For the love of charts

**The journo hivemind is worried about BNPL.** This week, two major publications did much hand-wringing over the growth of [credit card debt](https://every.) and the [impact of buy now, pay later (BNPL)](https://every.). Consumers who traditionally didnâ€™t use that much creditâ€”whether Gen Z or lower-income peopleâ€”are using more of it lately. Both articles infer that this trend is bad and predatory, and doom is nigh. _Did you hear? BNPL doesnâ€™t even report credit data to the major credit bureaus_ (for free, so that those credit bureaus can sell credit reports). Oh, the horror. 

Putting aside that there was [no new data in either piece](https://every.), there is, of course, another way of describing â€œextending credit to people who traditionally did not use that much of it.â€ Itâ€™s called [â€œcredit inclusion.â€](https://every.) Indeed, part of the explicit promise of BNPL is to bring lending to parts of the economy where it previously did not go, including toâ€”you guessed itâ€”Gen Z and low-income borrowers. Is that inclusive or predatory? In the damned-if-you-do-damned-if-you-donâ€™t-style of tech journalism, it will be predatory if the loans blow up, and it will be insufficiently inclusive if underwriting is too prudent. In the real world, however, itâ€™s going pretty well, at least for Affirm. Credit quality for Affirmâ€™s BNPL business is _improving_: 

_[![](https://proxy-prod.omnivore-image-cache.app/600x0,sHEZKrRKrKThhCM5ymieyVZ0bgX01dfkd9qzE9K1it4/https://d24ovhgu8s7341.cloudfront.net/uploads/editor/posts/3096/optimizedy56CgmbERKEpEBryzI21gVWvT8RPB3wTqtz6r2pg-cpIqdWy2eH-NaGgqDihGn16F68QAidGwlcNfmX1xiQ-Ia1KIP1iqHg-6IYMp8pNit1NysgPxjawsnoE8piWtFtW-Rt1bU7rJNcUeA0wXpo.png)](https://every.)_

[_Source: Affirm Shareholder Letter_](https://every.)_._

Delinquency rates are trending _lower_ than the previous two years. Could it get worse? Sure. Is BNPL a black box? Yes. But for now, the data shows that itâ€™s techno-optimism for the win. â€”[_Moses Sternstein_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlcmFuZG9td2Fsay5jby8iLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6NDB9)

The examined life

**Hello, open road:** I've been reading Jack Kerouac's [_On the Road_](https://every.), a classic coming-of-age story about a group of friends traveling through America in the 1940s. It has a "go, go, go" energy that makes me want to get on the first flight to Chicago and start hitchhiking my way west. The bookâ€™s sense of adventure is infectious because Kerouac's characters have no expectation about the end journey. Thereâ€™s no map, so they live spontaneously and free. When youâ€™re creating anything new, you have to trust your instincts and jump, even if you donâ€™t have everything figured out. Just pray youâ€™ll land on a bed of soft feathers. â€”[_Ash Sharma_](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly90d2l0dGVyLmNvbS9Bc2h3aW5yZWFkcyIsInBvc2l0aW9uIjo0Mn0=)

More great reads

[**Taste > skill**](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYWN0aW9uZGlnZXN0LmNvbS8iLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6NDN9). In a world where AI models can generate dozens of beautiful creations in less than a minute, taste will take on ever greater importance. But how do we cultivate it? [Explore the approaches](https://every.to/emails/click/6dc913eaf276f72ae60d9f5a14cfccd0ee00c1461a16b07f3deec67276660365/eyJzdWJqZWN0IjoiR3JpdHR5IFZlcnN1cyBHcmlmdHkgRm91bmRlcnMgYW5kIENvZGUgYXMgQ3JhZnQiLCJwb3N0X2lkIjozMDk2LCJwb3N0X3R5cGUiOiJwb3N0IiwidXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuYWN0aW9uZGlnZXN0LmNvbS8iLCJwb3NpdGlvbiI6NDR9) shared by Steve Jobs, Anna Wintour, and Rick Rubin.
